Professional History  
 
Total  / Prax  (Lindsey Oil Refinery) –Process Safety Engineer  – September 2016 to Current   
 
Provision of  process safety support to the refinery operations. Areas of activity include  the following : 
 
• Facilitation of safety studies (HAZOP, LOPA)  and process safety  risk assessments . 
• TUV (Rheinland) certif ied functional safety engineer.  
• Supporting refinery to better align to IE C 61511 requirements for functional safety management, inclusive 
of writing refinery standards and guides on LOPA and SRS preparation.  
• Mana gement and organis ation  of the refinery’s retrospective HAZOP and LOPA programmes , inclusive 
of appointment via competitive tender of a 3rd party contractor  to independently facilitate the studies . 
Provided process safety input to the studies  and acted as study scribe.  
• Recognised  competent person on site for reviewing management of change proposals from a process 
safety perspective , inclusive of active participate  in multidisciplinary design review, project risk 
assessments , and participat ion and facilitat ion of  safety studies (HAZOP, LOPA) to support the 
management of change processes. Significant projects include air -gapping of redundant unit and 
conversion of a distillate hydrotreater to alternative feedstocks.  
• Provided  process safety support to several major  projects on the refinery, including air -gapping  of 
redundant units  and a major project to convert a distillate hydrotreater to a heavier feedstock.  
• Experience managing  the refinery process safety KPI suite using recognised industry standards such as  
HSG 254 and API RP 754.  
• Member of refinery crisis management team  
• Trained internal auditor and conducts  audits o n refinery systems  
• Analysis of risk via fault and event tree preparation  
• Preparation of ALARP arguments  on various refinery operation , inclusive  of cost benefit analysis.
